page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: {Wood Farm}covers about 20 acres of grassand on which 10 charollais cows feed. The cows are not milked but the calves feed from their mother; this is called suckling.My (Vicky Oakley) great grandpa lived at Wood Farm which was formerly called Gibralter because a gibbet used to stand on the high land by the road. {W.H.GITTINS & SONS, HALL FARM, RUYTON {XI TOWNS.} The acreage farmed within the parish of Ruyton XI Towns is 1210.78 acres, plus a further 496 acres outside the parish giving a total of 1706.78 acres. Listed on the next page are the crops grown and for what purpose:-
